messages: e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:31): I don't suppose that there is a nice Qt way to find the amount of used and free disk space? I say "Qt way" because it would be nice to be platform-independent.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (09:40): marcusU: not that I know of
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:40): Yeah, I'm seeing that that's the case from my Googling.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (09:41): for posix systems, maybe statvfs
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:44): I was thinking of writing something like KDiskFree but using pie charts instead.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (09:44): hm, sorta like win98 IIRC
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:45): Yeah. I really think that a pie chart is more easier to see visually than a bar chart.

e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:48): I'm just starting actually trying to write some stuff in C++ with Qt. So I was looking for something easier like that, but unfortunately, it looks like a hard project since I don't know Windows well enough.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:49): Plus I'm annoyed that KDiskFree has ugly colors that are not configurable.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (09:54): or just make it non-windows for now and worry about that later
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (09:55): unless you'er using windows as we spea of course
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:55): Yeah. I guess so. I was just trying to be a "good boy" and write platform-independent code.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:56): I only occasionally use Windows at home.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (09:58): speaking of Windows, I still think they need to give Qt a face-lift for Vista.
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (09:59): probably prudent to do that
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (09:59): but how can you expect a 200 men team to accomodate all the innovations in three different platforms?
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (09:59): you are asking 200 developers to chase all the innovations going on at Apple, Microsoft and GNOME/KDE
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (09:59): even just small things.. it's mostly OK on vista
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (10:00): won't it be easier to take the conservative route with Qt? Just use it for backend business logic?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:00): but it'd be interesting if they had aero wizards, command links, etc
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (10:00): and use the native GUI for everything GUI?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:00): the new UI stuff in vista..

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:01): hm, old graphics card?
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:02): But I don't need transparent windows or games. The only thing I do is use Linux/Qt/KDE and play DVDs.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:03): redear: maybe.. but it isn't really designed for being a back-end, not that it can't be.
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (10:03): it's a start
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (10:03): most frameworks involves something like Qt, plus your own framework
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:03): Does Qt use native Windows widgets on Windows?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:03): no, they don't use native widgets
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (10:03): after that i guess you can work in peace on your business logic
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:04): blockd: I read something that they use some kind of HID renderer on OS X.
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (10:04): what's a good c++ backend framework for serving the business logic then?
5022cf57fb9482c659ea223f7e36b50d (10:04): something that provides you a platform agnostic DB/memory/file/etc/etc
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:05): marcusU: on mac and windows they use native API's for rendering, but they're not the "native" widgets AFAIK
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:05): that's why the mac and winxp style are only available on the respective platofrms
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:05): I just looked, they use HIThemes -- whatever that is.

e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:07): Meters? I used to like the kind of dial-like widgets I got on lots of NeXTSTEP apps. Apple didn't keep those. :-(
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:07): When I turn on progress bar animation in KDE, I get nauseated!

e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:13): blockd: From the page you showed me, I see several different widgets that show the concept of something being partly completely. They different in their appearance for no obvious reason. It's all a confusing mess.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:13): But Windows users are used to have every app have a different widget style.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:14): yeah, just search to the second mention of "meters", that's what all progress bars actually seem to be like
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:14): even for apps compiled for WinXP, so they wouldn't have had any way of adjusting for vista
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:15): And I don't understand why they don't want the progress bar to show the percent complete.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:15): better yet, search for "Use progress bars only for progress. Use meters to indicate a percentage that is not related to progress."
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:15): well, it probably just wouldn't look good
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:16): Windows has never good very good.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:16): I don't think that the distinction between meters and progress bars is a useful one.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:16): Vista isn't so bad looking, despite its other numerous problems
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:17): nope, in fact as far as I can tell they've actually replaced progress bars with meters
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:17): despite what those docs say.. I haven't seen a "progress bar" in vista except in Qt now :\
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:17): just meteres
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:18): I think that percentage is a very useful item and should be shown.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:19): it's useful, but just philosophizing, can't a person tell just as well from looking at it?
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:19): Some people like the percentage. Some people like the absolute number. Why not give them both, such as "500 out of 1000 files (50%) copied"?
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (10:20): And if it's really a slow operation, it's nice to watch the update 501 files copied, 502, 503, etc.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:22): but that's not related to percentage at that point
